page.title: 14Rawmarsh area: main features
page.content: {THE ROMAN RIDGE} The Roman Ridge, or Balk or Dyke, is a 15 mile long earthwork in the Don valley. Built not by the Romans but by the Celts, the purpose of this relic is unknown. It consists of 5 miles of footpaths, 2 miles of public highways and 8 miles which is either built on or is on private property.{ { {VICTORIA (ROSEHILL) PARK { }The park, opened in 1901, has a public bowling green, an aviary, and tennis courts. There is a children's playground and a paddling pool and a bandstand which is no longer used. { {NEW STUBBIN COLLIERY Sinking began in 1913 as Low Stubbin colliery became exhausted. New Stubbin had four main seams and closed in 1978. It is now used as a depot.
